result.execSummary:
The defendant Cynthia Decorah was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Credit for 59 days only if revoked.

miscConds.notes: To be collected through the Clerk of Court's office.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
No consumption or possession of alcohol. No entry into any bars or taverns.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Huber allowed. Eligible for community service under 973.09(7m). Court has no objections to serving the jail sentence in any other county in the State of Wisconsin, but is the ultimate decision of the Sheriff(s).

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Jail term in Count #1

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Cynthia Decorah in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:38 PM. Called 15CF184 and 17CF141. State - here for a change of plea - on 17CF141 - defendant would plead G to counts #1 and #2 as alleged, joint recommendation on count #1 of a fine of $300 plus costs and on count #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohiok and no entry into any bars, taverns or similar Class B establishments, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 120 hours of community service; on 15CF184 - DRI counts #1 and #3, plead as alleged to counts #2 and #4, joint recommendation on #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years, remainder of sentence is free to argue - State is asking for 1 year of conditional jail otherwise same conditions of probation as other case except an additional 200 hours of community service and take all medications as prescribed by treating physician or medical care provider. Lynch - on count #2 of 15CF184 - deleting the "use of a dangerous weapon" enhancer. State agrees. Court does not have that enhancer on the case. Clerk explains. Court - recess as matters are not clear at this point (1:44 PM). Recalled at 2:47 PM with same appearances. Lynch - has resolved confusion - on 15CF184 - defendant would plead to count #1 after deleting the enhancer of use of a dangerous weapon and to count #4 as alleged, dismiss and read in counts #2 and #3. Decorah and State agree. Court - 15CF184 - amends count #1 to delete the "use of a dangerous weapon" enhancer. Decorah pleads G to amended count #1 and count #4 as alleged. Court makes sure the defendant knows what it means for a count to be DRI. Court dismisses and reads in count #2 and #4 on 15CF184. On 17CF141 - Decorah pleads G to counts #1 and#2 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - asks Court to follow joint recommendation and also asks for the 1 year of conditional jail time on count #1 of 15CF184 and 9 months conditional jail on count #4 of same case, on 17CF141 - count #1 - $300.00 fine plus costs and on count #2 - 3 years probation with conditions as previously set - believes the defendant has at least 9 days credit. Lynch makes final argument prior to sentencing - has 211 days credit on 15CF84 and 94 days credit on 17CF141 - recommends on 15CF184 case - 9 months of conditional jail, concurrent to count #4 of 9 months - asks for good time and huber and transfer to another county jail (resident of Milwaukee). Discussion on credit - Lynch willing to work work with State and submit to Court thru stipulation. Decorah withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: on 15CF184 - count #1 - 3 years probation with conditions of: 1 year in FC jail - huber allowed - eligible for community service under 973.09(7m) - credit for 59 days only if revoked - court has no objections to serving the sentence in any other County in the State of WI but it is the ultimate decision of the Sheriff(s), AODA and follow thru, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 200 hours of community service, costs - 60 DTP after release from custody/CO; count #4 - 9 months in FCjail - concurrent to jail term on count #1, costs - 60 DTP after release from custody/Co; 17CF141, count #1 - $300.00 fine plus costs - 60 DTP after release from custody/CO, count #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years - concurrent to 15CF184, same conditions except no addtional jail time or community service, costs - 60 DTP after release from incarceration, credit for 47 days only if revoked on 17CF141, submit DNA sample, felony rights given, right to appeal, adjourned.
Final pre-trial on May 30, 2018 at 04:15 pm.

Defendant Cynthia Decorah in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Defendant Cynthia Decorah in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:06 PM. Court - here for bail bond forfeiture hearing and explains to Decorah what that means. Lynch not sure if there is an explanation for her non-appearance and states he objected to the bond forfeiture when it was ordered as he did not have any information as to why she was not in Court when ordered to be so. State - asks for Court to forfeit the posted bond for stated reasons. Court confirms forfeiture for stated reasons. Lynch asks for Court to set it for another FPT, two cases. State - bond - asks for $3000.00 cash for stated reasons. Lynch - asks for lower cash bond or signature bond for stated reasons. Court - bond - $2000.00, set for FPT along with her other open case.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 30, 2018 at 04:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing on May 23, 2018 at 02:00 pm.
Notification of Warrant Detainer - Kenosha County
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 300.00.

Attorney Chad Lynch in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:30 PM. Called 15CF184 and 17CF141. Lynch stands mute in regards to the whereabouts of his client. Court reviews file in regards to the objected bail bond forfeiture, confirms forfeiture of $2500.00 on 15CF184. State aks for the $300.00 on this matter to be forfeited as well. Lynch objects. Court forfeits $300.00 cash, issues bench warrant, body or $3000.00 (per State's recommendation). On 17CF141 - State asks for bench warrant, body or $1000.00. Court so orders.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Final pre-trial on January 10, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Cynthia Decorah in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Defendant Cynthia Decorah in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:27 PM. CAlled 15CF184 and 17CF141. State - here for FPT on 15CF184 and INIT on 17CF141. On 17CF141 - Lynch has gone over the complaint and charges, waives further reading, wish to proceed to waiver of PH on that matter today and have gone over that with the defendant. Decorah agrees. Court does verbal waiver of PH collaquey, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Lynch is willing to move forward to ARGN with the understanding that the State will file the Information that mirrors the complaint. State agrees. Lynch pleads NG to all counts, waives reading of any Information. Court accepts pleas, sets this matter for FPT. Lynch would like both matters set for a FPT on same date and time. Lynch makes argument for the forfeiture of the bond on 15CF184, asks Court to reinstate bond of $2500.00 cash for reasons stated. State - bond on 15CF184 - argues for Court to forfeit bond and set new bond. Court states that notice has to be given to Amanda Stage in case it was her money that she posted, set for another date for the bail bond forfeiture. State - bond - $3000.00 cash on 15CF184 and signature bond on 17CF141. Lynch - bond - asks for signature bond on 17CF141 and lower cash bond on 15CF184. Court - bond - $500.00 cash on 15CF184; bond on 17CF141 - $500.00 signature bond with same conditions.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 10, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
Final pre-trial on November 8, 2017 at 01:45 pm.

Attorney Chad Lynch in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:56 PM. Lynch - advises Court that the defendant is coming from Milwaukee and has been in contact with her, believes she informed the COC office that she was running late. Court forfeits bond posted, issues bench warrant, body or $3000l.00. Lynch gives verbal objection to bond forfeiture. Court to set for bond forfeiture hearing.
Final pre-trial on October 4, 2017 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Cynthia Decorah in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Defendant Cynthia Decorah in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:17 PM. Lynch - will be representing the defendant, does not foresee any conflict issue. Court reviews file - was set for FPT in February of 2016, warrant has been active since March of 2016, Court suggests setting it for a JT. Lynch asks to set the matter for FPT for stated reasons. State - bond - $10,000 cash bond for stated reasons. Lynch - bond - asks for lower cash bond or signature bond. Court - bond - $3000.00 cash. Court sets for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 4, 2017 at 01:15 pm.

Status conference on August 30, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Arrested Milwaukee County - Transfered to FOSO

Attorney Mary L. Roth Burns in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:27 AM. Burns - not sure where her client is. State asks for forfeiture of any bond posted and bench warrant, body or $2500.00. Court forfeits bond posted, issues bench warrant, body or $2500.00.

Attorney Mary L. Roth Burns in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:45 PM. Attorney indicates that defendant had car trouble and there is no current offer. Bednar states offer was sent but nothing on the offer, unsure of why the offer was blank and sent. Burns asks for adjournment. Bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Cynthia Decorah in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:06 PM. State - believes the PH is being waived. Burns agrees in regards to a waiver. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to PH, finds probable cause, binds her over for trial. State has filed an Information. Burns has Information that does not mirror the complaint, waives reading of it, not sure if motions will be filed to challenge the Information, but enters NG pleas to all counts, asking for 6-7 weeks for FPT. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, set for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Cynthia Decorah in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant Cynthia Decorah in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:01 AM. Also called companion case 15CF185 (State vs Ernest Evans). Ernest Evans appears in person and his attorney Michael Chernin appears telephonically with leave of the Court. Decorah and Burns have complaint. Court reads complaint for Decorah first. Decorah understands charges and penalties. Evans understands charges and penalties. Court instructs counsel on current bond conditions (Decorah - $7500.00 cash that is not posted and Evans - $7500.00 that is posted). Burns asks for reduction in bond for Decorah from $7500.00 to $2000.00 for stated reasons. State - bond - no objections to a reduction in bond but wants some cash yet (at least $2000.00). Court - bond on Decorah - reduces to $2000.00 cash with same conditions, sets for PH. Burns and Chernin waive time limits for PH's. Court continues bond on Evans case. Court will track all citations - no notice sent.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
